article_title: Pedestrian fatally struck by drunk driving suspect early Saturday in Arlington
article_text:
An Arlington man was fatally struck early Saturday morning by a drunk driving suspect, Arlington police said.

Around 2:15 a.m. police responded to a report of a crash in the 2600 block of West Division Street, near South Bowen Road, and found Terry Dow lying in the roadway.

Police said investigators determined Dow was struck by a pickup truck while trying to cross West Division Street. He was transported to an area hospital, but later died of his injuries.

Dow was killed on his 45th birthday, according to the Tarrant County Medical Examiner’s office.

According to police, Randy Culberson, the driver of the pickup truck, fled the scene, but later returned and called 911. Culberson, 56, was arrested on suspicion of driving while intoxicated and failure to stop and render aid.

The crash remains under investigation.

Around 2:15 a.m. police responded to a report of a crash in the 2600 block of West Division Street, near South Bowen Road, and found Terry Dow lying in the roadway.
Culberson, 56, was arrested on suspicion of driving while intoxicated and failure to stop and render aid.
